title: Variables - Storing Information
description: Learn how to store and use data with variables
content: Variables are like labeled boxes that store information. You can put different types of data in them and use them later!
starter_code:
# Variables - storing information
name = "Your Name"
age = 10
favorite_color = "blue"

# Use your variables
print("Hi! My name is", name)
print("I am", age, "years old")
print("My favorite color is", favorite_color)
expected_output:
Hi! My name is Your Name
I am 10 years old
My favorite color is blue
hints: Use quotes for text like names

title: Making Decisions with If
description: Teach your programs to make smart decisions
content: If statements help your code make choices based on different conditions. They make your programs smart!

title: Loops - Repeating Actions
description: Learn to repeat actions efficiently with loops
content: Loops help you do things multiple times without writing the same code over and over!
starter_code:
# Loops - repeating actions

# Count to 5
for i in range(1, 6):
    print("Count:", i)

# Loop through colors
colors = ["red", "blue", "green"]
for color in colors:
    print("I like", color)
expected_output:
Count: 1
Count: 2
Count: 3
Count: 4
Count: 5
I like red
I like blue
I like green

title: Build Your First AI Chatbot
description: Create a simple AI chatbot that responds to messages
content: Learn to build your very own AI chatbot! This fun project combines everything you have learned.
starter_code:
# Simple AI Chatbot
import random

# Chatbot responses
responses = {
    'hello': ['Hi there!', 'Hello!', 'Hey!']
    'how are you': ['I am great!', 'Doing well!']
    'bye': ['Goodbye!', 'See you later!']
}

print(" Chatbot: Hello! I'm your AI friend!")
user_input = input("You: ")

# Simple response logic
if 'hello' in user_input.lower():
    print(" Chatbot:", random.choice(responses['hello']))
elif 'bye' in user_input.lower():
    print(" Chatbot:", random.choice(responses['bye']))
else:
    print(" Chatbot: That's interesting! Tell me more!")
expected_output:
Chatbot: Hello! I'm your AI friend!
You: [user input]
 Chatbot: [response based on input]
